claudioillanes wrote:
> 
> Hi everyone!
> 
> Here is a question regarding enabling and disabling testMethods. I am
> running several .class tests in my suite() and I would like to have
> some flexibility as far as running different subsets of tests. I have
> created a "TestClient" with a main that collects command line
> arguments to know what subset of parametrized tests to run. I'd also
> like to include "levels" of testing. Basically, I'd like to be able
> to run certain sets of tests based on a command line parameter.
> eg.) java TestClient <-detailed | -normal | -brief >
> The only option I can seem to think of is to have the suite add tests
> by methodName and do so conditionally (based on a static global
> variable).
> 
> if(detailed){
>    suite.addTest(newTestClient("testItemA"))
> }
> 
> The problem with this is that I'd have to list every single
> testMethod for the test. Instead, I'd like to add the tests to the
> suite as .class files and use any another approach. Can anyone think
> of anything? Any suggestions out there?

It sounds like you could reuse the Ant <junit>/<batchtest> tags somehow. 
Could you rebuild your TestClient to run Ant in embedded mode and 
general a target on the fly? I've never tried it, but it might be very 
simple. Ask around on Ant mailing lists about invoking Ant tasks 
programmatically.
